boat.name: Leader
boat.full_description:
Built in 1892, on the River Dart at W A Gibbs yard, Galmpton, 'Leader' was one of the largest of the Brixham sailing trawlers, known, despite their ketch rig, as the ‘Big Sloops’.

She fished out of Lowestoft until 1907 when she was sold to Swedish owners, and operated on the west coast of Sweden. In 1952 she was converted to a motor cargoboat and in 1969 the Swedish Sailing and Cruising Association re-rigged her for use as a training vessel.

Don and Gillian Hind bought her in 1983 and chartered her off the west coast of Scotland when she was called 'Lorne Leader'. In 1996 she returned to South Devon, operating from Dartmouth until 1999 when she became part of the Trinity Sailing fleet at Brixham.

Watch the video of the 'Leader Project' by Trinity Sailing Foundation, completed in 2012.
boat.short_description: One of the largest Brixham sailing trawlers, built in 1892, 'Leader' spent many years operating off the west coast of Sweden before returning to her home waters of South Devon.
